p: Being elderly did not affect climate health risk perceptions, although the elderly are at particular risk from extreme heat [ 53]. Public opinion polls have shown few differences in age on climate change beliefs and risk perceptions; the elderly appear mildly less concerned than middle-aged populations [ 54]. Previous work has shown that health risk perceptions of older people are elevated for conditions to which they believe they are particularly prone, such as cancer [ 55]. Climate change-related health impacts may seem to be too far removed in the future for the elderly to find them of personal concern.
